Detailed Description

Readable that also writes everything it reads to a file.

Mainly for use in RouteModule where the cached map is exactly the one sent from MapModule. This is to avoid too many changes in the RouteModule.

Definition at line 77 of file ModuleMap.h.

AutoWritingReadable::AutoWritingReadable (  Readable *  readable,
const char *  filename,
const byte *  header = NULL,
int  headerSize = 0
) 
 

Creates a new AutoWritingReadable.

The header should be deleted by the caller.

Parameters:
readable Readable to read from and then write.
filename Final filename to put the cached data into.
header Header to write first in file.
headerSize Size of header.

AutoWritingReadable::~AutoWritingReadable (   ) 
 

Renames the temporary file to the right filename if all reads were succesful.

Deletes the Readable.

size_t  size,
uint32  timeout
)  [virtual]
 

Tries to copy size bytes into buffer.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to put the result into.
size The numbeer of bytes to read.
timeout The timeout. Not implemented, will wait forever.
Returns:
The number of bytes read or a negative number if failure or timeout.

Implements Readable.

ssize_t AutoWritingReadable::read (  byte *  buffer,
size_t  size
)  [virtual]
 

Tries to copy size bytes into buffer.

Also writes the data to a file if the reading was succesful.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to put the result into.
size The numbeer of bytes to read.
Returns:
The number of bytes read or a negative number.

Implements Readable.
